eu.greenlightning.hypercubepdf.container

Class HCPTablePosition

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.greenlightning.hypercubepdf.container.HCPTablePosition

  • public class HCPTablePosition
extends Object
    Describes the position of an HCPElement inside an HCPTableContainer. An element may extend over multiple continuous columns and / or rows. Therefore the position is defined by the x- and y-coordinates of the element as well as the number of columns and rows spanned.

    This class is immutable.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int REMAINING
      Can be used as a span value to indicate that the element should always extend to the end of the container spanning over all remaining columns or rows.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HCPTablePosition(HCPElement element, int x, int y)
      Creates a new HCPTablePosition using the specified element and position.
      HCPTablePosition(HCPElement element, int x, int y, int horizontalSpan, int verticalSpan)
      Creates a new HCPTablePosition using the specified element, position and spans.

    • Field Detail

      • REMAINING

        public static final int REMAINING
        Can be used as a span value to indicate that the element should always extend to the end of the container spanning over all remaining columns or rows.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • HCPTablePosition

        public HCPTablePosition(HCPElement element,
                        int x,
                        int y)
        Creates a new HCPTablePosition using the specified element and position.
        Parameters:
        element - not null
        x - must be >= 0
        y - must be >= 0
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if element is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if x or y contains an illegal value

      • HCPTablePosition

        public HCPTablePosition(HCPElement element,
                        int x,
                        int y,
                        int horizontalSpan,
                        int verticalSpan)
        Creates a new HCPTablePosition using the specified element, position and spans.
        Parameters:
        element - not null
        x - must be >= 0
        y - must be >= 0
        horizontalSpan - must be >= 1 or REMAINING
        verticalSpan - must be >= 1 or REMAINING
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if element is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if x, y, horizontalSpan or verticalSpan contains an illegal value

      • isAt

        public boolean isAt(int x,
                    int y)
        Returns whether this position has the specified coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate to test for
        y - the y-coordinate to test for
        Returns:
        true if the coordinates of this position match the specified coordinates; false otherwise

      • getX

        public int getX()
        Returns the x-coordinate of this position.

      • getY

        public int getY()
        Returns the y-coordinate of this position.
        Returns:
        the y-coordinate

      • getRightX

        public int getRightX()
        Returns the right-most x-coordinate spanned by this position. If this position does not span multiple columns, the value of getX() is returned. If this position spans all remaining columns, the value of getX() is returned by default as well.
        Returns:
        the right-most x-coordinate

      • getLowerY

        public int getLowerY()
        Returns the lowest y-coordinate spanned by this position. If this position does not span multiple rows, the value of getY() is returned. If this position spans all remaining rows, the value of getY() is returned by default as well.
        Returns:
        the lowest y-coordinate

      • spans

        public boolean spans()
        Returns whether this position spans multiple columns and / or rows.
        Returns:
        whether this position spans multiple columns and / or rows

      • spansHorizontally

        public boolean spansHorizontally()
        Returns whether this position spans multiple columns.
        Returns:
        whether this position spans multiple columns

      • spansVertically

        public boolean spansVertically()
        Returns whether this position spans multiple rows.
        Returns:
        whether this position spans multiple rows

      • horizontallyRemaining

        public boolean horizontallyRemaining()
        Returns whether this position spans over all remaining columns.
        Returns:
        whether this position spans all remaining columns

      • verticallyRemaining

        public boolean verticallyRemaining()
        Returns whether this position spans over all remaining rows.
        Returns:
        whether this position spans all remaining rows

      • getHorizontalSpan

        public int getHorizontalSpan()
        Returns the number of columns spanned by this position. A value of 1 indicates that this position spans only one column and is a regular position. This method may also return the special value REMAINING which indicates that the position spans all remaining columns in the HCPTableContainer.
        Returns:
        the number of columns spanned by this position or REMAINING

      • getVerticalSpan

        public int getVerticalSpan()
        Returns the number of rows spanned by this position. A value of 1 indicates that this position spans only one row and is a regular position. This method may also return the special value REMAINING which indicates that the position spans all remaining rows in the HCPTableContainer.
        Returns:
        the number of rows spanned by this position or REMAINING
